author: AOL Staff
title: Beyond Meat founder and CEO: The arc of history is on our side [Video]
text: Beyond Meat founder and CEO: The arc of history is on our side Cooking up change in a well-entrenched, well-capitalized industry isn't easy. Such is the story of the ticker symbol BYND, formally known down supermarket aisles across America as Beyond Meat ( [BYND](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/BYND?p=BYND&.tsrc=fin-srch)). While the price of Beyond Meat stock has changed over the years, its CEO and founder Ethan Brown hasn’t. The basketball-loving former fuel cell industry exec remains laser-focused on taking the company he founded in 2009 with his own savings to the next level. "We believe the arc of history is on our side and that we're going to make this thing into the long-term success that we've been after," Brown said on the latest episode of Yahoo Finance's [Lead This Way](https://finance.yahoo.com/live/lead-this-way/) (video above). Beyond Meat burst onto investors' radar on May 5, 2019, with a [sizzling initial public offering](https://finance.yahoo.com/video/inside-c-suite-beyond-meat-142652541.html) on the Nasdaq. Investors devoured shares of a company they saw as the leader in the budding plant-based food movement. The company priced its IPO at $25 a share, opened for trading at $46, and then surged to $65.75 by the close. The gain when that closing bell sounded: a tasty 163%. From there, it was a whirlwind of activity for Beyond Meat and Brown, with [big deals](https://finance.yahoo.com/video/dunkin-beyond-meat-ceos-sit-134145185.html) with global restaurant chains such as Yum! Brands-owned KFC and Dunkin’ Donuts ( [YUM](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/YUM?p=YUM&.tsrc=fin-srch)), expansion plans into the refrigerated food sections at Target ( [TGT](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/TGT?p=TGT&.tsrc=fin-srch)) and retailers overseas, and efforts underway to expand manufacturing capacity and create new plant-based items. By July 2019, shares of Beyond Meat hit a peak of $234.90 a share. However, the [COVID-19 pandemic](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/campbell-soup-ceo-how-to-lead-successfully-with-a-military-mindset-202727449.html) hammered the restaurant industry, and its financial toll sent people back to cheaper meat-based items at supermarkets. Beyond Meat’s impressive momentum stalled along with the rest of the plant-based food movement, including at rival [Impossible Foods](https://finance.yahoo.com/video/impossible-foods-ceo-hyper-growth-150112112.html). Along the way, attacks from entrenched parties in the meat industry and media on the healthiness of plant-based items hurt Beyond Meat’s standing with consumers. By November 2022, with losses eating into cash flow, the company was forced to lay off 19% of its workforce. Then in November of this year, Beyond Meat — which has cut prices to stimulate demand — said it would slash 19% of its non-production workforce after a softer-than-expected third quarter. [Third quarter sales](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1655210/000165521023000255/ex991pressrelease-q32023ea.htm) fell 8.7% from the prior year to $75.3 million. The company lost $57.5 million on an adjusted operating profit basis. "You know that there's going to be resistance to change, and maybe early on we felt that when we first launched, and particularly after the IPO, that it was going to happen overnight," Brown told Yahoo Finance several months before the latest round of layoffs. "That obviously has not proven to be the case." "But the very reason that we started this company and the very reason that consumers are reaching for a product strengthens every single day, whether it's the health angle, whether it's climate, whether it's the energy and water use or animal welfare," Brown continued. "All of those issues are intensifying, and we have a solution that is available to anyone who wants it." Today, Beyond Meat stock trades at $8.95 a share — well off its dizzying post-IPO heights. The company's market cap is $577.6 million compared to $18.46 billion for [meat king](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tyson-foods-ceo-on-growth-potential-for-chicken-in-challenging-economic-times-223501341.html) Tyson ( [TSN](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/TSN?p=TSN&.tsrc=fin-srch)), per Yahoo Finance [comparison data](https://finance.yahoo.com/compare?comps=BYND,TSN). "In terms of what’s driving the US softness, it’s more of the same: Consumers just continue to shy away from the category for a variety of reasons, including taste and perceived health benefits (or the lack thereof)," JPMorgan packaged food analyst Ken Goldman said. Goldman rates Beyond Meat shares Underweight, the equivalent of a Sell rating. Meanwhile, Brown remains focused on defying the critics. Beyond Meat has recently opened a sprawling 288,000-square-foot headquarters in a former aircraft hangar in El Segundo, Calif., steps away from the HQ of Barbie [maker](https://finance.yahoo.com/video/barbie-brand-very-large-canvas-152040865.html) Mattel ( [MAT](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MAT?p=MAT&.tsrc=fin-srch)). The location is outfitted with a state-of-the-art test kitchen and a generally open floor plan that may foster the next big thing in plant-based food. The new facility even has a McDonald’s ( [MCD](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MCD?p=MCD&.tsrc=fin-srch)) themed test kitchen where the company focuses on cooking up potential new items for the Golden Arches. The 6-foot-5 Brown has a corner office with his KPIs (key performance indicators) on the outside wall to encourage employee discussion. Brown often makes the rounds in the building to chat up employees with his trademark cool, welcoming vibe. Brown acknowledged that the road ahead won’t be easy and he isn't yet in the mindset to reflect on the path of the business to this point. But he will not be deterred in his personal mission to do good for the planet by leading with heart and hustle. "I have to see [my mission] through to completion," Brown said. "I think it'll be something [that] when it's said and done, I might look back. But right now I'm in the fight, so it's hard to see." [Brian Sozzi](https://www.yahoo.com/author/brian-sozzi/) is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on Twitter/X [@BrianSozzi](https://twitter.com/BrianSozzi) and on [Click here for the latest stock market news and in-depth analysis, including events that move stocks](https://finance.yahoo.com/topic/stock-market-news/) [Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/)

author: Redação
title: São Paulo puxou queda da indústria em julho
text:
Dados divulgados hoje pela Pesquisa Industrial Mensal (PIM) Regional do IBGE apontam que na passagem de junho para julho, a produção industrial brasileira caiu 1,4%, com decréscimos em apenas três dos 15 locais investigados: Pará (-3,8%), Bahia (-2,3%) e São Paulo (-1,8%). Já os avanços mais acentuados foram registrados no Amazonas (6,9%) e no Espírito Santo (5,8%).
Paraná (4,4%), Pernambuco (4,2%), Região Nordeste (3,0%), Minas Gerais (2,1%), Ceará (1,9%), Mato Grosso (1,8%), Rio de Janeiro (1,4%), Santa Catarina (1,3%), Goiás (1,2%) e Rio Grande do Sul (0,8%) completam o rol de UFs com resultados positivos em julho de 2024.
Bernardo Almeida, analista da pesquisa, esclarece que a soma dos resultados regionais não resulta no resultado nacional divulgado na semana anterior.
“A leitura que fazemos é que o índice nacional apontou um recuo de 1,4% e, em termos regionais, três locais seguem esse mesmo movimento ou comportamento. É preciso salientar que o resultado regional não esgota o resultado do Brasil, ou seja, uma parte da produção nacional não é vista pelos resultados regionais, já que são apenas 15 locais pesquisados. Dessa forma, como as séries de cada local são formadas independentemente, inclusive a do Brasil, o resultado nacional atua como parâmetro para a análise regional. Ainda, aplicando-se o ajuste sazonal, as séries perdem a singularidade do chamado fator aditividade. Assim, o somatório das partes não resulta no todo. Desse modo, o resultado nacional não deriva da soma dos resultados regionais”, explica Almeida.
Ele ressalta que o recuo de 1,4% está concentrado nas atividades com maior peso dentro da amostra nacional. Houve quedas nos setores de produtos derivados de petróleo, no setor extrativo e de alimentos.
O Pará, que representa 4,1% da produção industrial nacional, voltou a recuar após registrar crescimento nos meses de junho e maio de 2024, período em que acumulou ganho de 25,3%. A indústria local foi afetada por queda no setor de minerais não metálicos. Na indústria baiana, com queda de 2,3%, os setores de produtos químicos e celulose influenciaram negativamente. O estado responde por 3,9% da produção nacional e acumulou perda de 7,9% em dois meses seguidos de queda na produção.
Já São Paulo, que é o mais diversificado industrialmente e representa 33% da produção industrial, foi a maior influência e interrompeu três meses consecutivos de taxas positivas, período em que acumulou avanço de 4,1%.
“A queda de 1,8%, acima da média nacional, acabou eliminando parte do crescimento acumulado no período. A indústria farmacêutica influenciou negativamente o resultado da produção paulista. Com esse resultado, a indústria local ainda se encontra 2,2% acima do patamar pré-pandemia”, completa Almeida.
Ele observa que, nos últimos meses, a indústria vem apresentando comportamento oscilante. No mês anterior, junho, o crescimento de 4,1% ocorreu num movimento natural de recuperação da indústria impulsionado pela retomada de plantas industriais do Rio Grande do Sul, paralisadas em maio. O analista diz que essa nova queda em julho está relacionada a condições macroeconômicas desfavoráveis.
“Observamos a indústria nacional caminhando num ritmo aquém da sua capacidade operacional. Há uma melhora no ritmo de produção e, se formos observar sob a ótica do patamar pré-pandemia, encontramos nove locais operando acima desse patamar. São eles: Mato Grosso (21,3% acima), Rio de Janeiro (11,9%), Mina Gerais (11,4%) Amazonas (8,1%) Paranã (7,9%) Santa Catarina (7,3%), Goiás (4,3%), Rio Grande do Sul (3,5%) e São Paulo (2,2%). Todos estão também acima da média nacional que é de 1,4%”, diz.
Ele ressalta que há um crescimento no ritmo de produção, mas, ao mesmo tempo, observa-se também que a indústria caminha de forma moderada. No lado da demanda, observa-se a taxa de juros em patamares elevados impactando na renda disponível e no consumo das famílias. No lado da oferta, os juros encarecem o crédito e inibem a tomada de decisão de investimentos.
“Por um lado, temos uma melhora no mercado de trabalho e, por outro, temos a taxa de juros refreando os efeitos desse fator positivo. Isso explica esse quadro oscilante no comportamento da indústria”, analisa almeida.
O Índice de Confiança do Empresário Industrial, pedido pela Confederação Nacional da Indústria, mostra que o PIB do segundo trimestre superou as expectativas, impulsionado em grande parte pelo setor industrial, fato que vem estimulando o otimismo do empresariado. Segundo a CNI, a confiança do setor cresceu pelo segundo mês consecutivo, aumentando 1,6 ponto em setembro e alcançando os 53,3 pontos.
Ainda de acordo com o levantamento, o componente que mede as expectativas dos empresários da indústria quanto ao futuro de seus próprios negócios e da economia do país subiu 1,5 ponto, para 55,4 pontos em setembro, o que reflete mais otimismo dos industriais para os próximos seis meses. O gerente de Análise Econômica da CNI, Marcelo Azevedo, atribui esse movimento ao resultado do PIB do segundo trimestre de 2024 e ao desempenho do setor.
“O PIB do segundo trimestre surpreendeu positivamente, com relevante participação do setor industrial, o que é uma boa notícia para o empresariado. Isso pode ter influenciado tanto a avaliação das condições atuais quanto das expectativas. Em termos de produção, emprego e mesmo de intenção de investimentos, a indústria vem registrando dados positivos, o que certamente melhora a confiança”, comentou.
Em outra pesquisa também da CNI, divulgada no último dia 10, os indicadores industriais continuam a mostrar elevação do nível de atividade industrial na comparação com 2023. Em julho, frente a junho de 2024, houve, por exemplo, evolução das horas trabalhadas na produção.
Com informações da Agência de Notícias IBGE e da Agência Brasil

author: Get News
title: Discover the Magic and Wisdom of Nature with Dr. Med Emmanuel Anyangwe Ngassa’ Latest Novels Walpurgis – Die Fruhlingswette and Pa Toroki: The Heavenly Banquet | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
Are you someone who loves to dwell his imagination onto the pages of a fictional world full of adventures, magic, and much more? Then, surely you need to grab Dr. Med. Emmanuel Anyangwe Ngassa' amazing pieces of fiction through which he has invited readers into enchanting realms where magic, nature, and adventure intertwine with profound life lessons in his latest releases, WALPURGIS – DIE FRÜHLINGSWETTE and PA TOROKI: THE HEAVENLY BANQUET.
In WALPURGIS – DIE FRÜHLINGSWETTE , Dr. Ngassa crafts a thrilling tale set against the backdrop of Walpurgis Night, a magical event where witches, devils, and supernatural beings convene. The narrative follows an ambitious devil determined to win a prestigious contest by leaping an incredible distance and placing a boulder as proof of his magical prowess. As the devil faces unforeseen challenges, the story explores themes of Magic and Supernatural, Competition and Ambition, and Surprise and Unpredictability. This novel captivates with its unexpected twists and immersive magical world, promising readers a rich and imaginative experience.
In PA TOROKI: THE HEAVENLY BANQUET takes readers on an allegorical journey through the vibrant and competitive world of animal societies. Central to the story is Pa Toroki, a clever tortoise who uses his wit and cunning to secure a place at a grand heavenly banquet. The novel delves into themes of Communication and Information Sharing, Trust and Deception, Community and Competition, and Survival and Strategy. Through the interactions and rivalries of various animal species, Dr. Ngassa imparts valuable moral and ethical lessons, making the book both educational and entertaining.
Dr. Ngassa's storytelling not only entertains but also engages readers emotionally, helping them build patience, cope with uncertainty, and achieve a sense of accomplishment. His books are ideal for a wide audience, including children, adults, parents, caretakers, and nature enthusiasts.
About Author:
Dr. Med. Emmanuel Anyangwe Ngassa is an acclaimed author known for his ability to weave rich narratives that blend adventure with profound life lessons. His latest works continue this tradition, offering readers of all ages stories that entertain, educate, and inspire.

author: L_104370
title: 连云港人的"苏超"故事：藏在绿茵场上的热爱
text:
2025年07月23日11:12 | 小字号
“泰州队实力不容小觑，连云港队下一个主场不能掉以轻心。”“淮安队的比分也追上来了，进前八是场硬仗。”连云港队轮空“苏超”第七轮比赛，港城球迷始终在关注着其他队伍的表现与比分，分析连云港队接下来几轮的胜算。当下，港城的足球爱好者在绿茵场上尽情奔跑，一片片绿茵场上，在热爱与拼搏间，港城人书写着超越胜负、属于每一个普通人的“苏超”故事。
小将追风，绿茵场上的明日之星
“小桃子，脚踝锁没锁死？”“张沐泽，到另一边去，防守。”场上，一年级、二年级的孩子们正在进行攻防，一旁的马威教练看着孩子们的动作，不断地进行提醒。上一周，马威带这群小朋友到南京参加2025江苏省青少年足球精英联赛（中国青少年足球联赛江苏赛区）小学组男子U8比赛，这群足球小将在25个队伍的角逐中取得了第八名的好成绩。
“很多孩子都是第一次参加比赛，特别激动。”马威告诉记者，“苏超”火了之后，作为教练，她能明显感受到孩子们踢球的劲头上来了。“以前是从运动中获得快乐，现在是竞技与城市荣誉串联，大家都在为连云港队加油，特别是吴世东教练的小学员，知道自己的教练在连云港队踢球，之后连云港队的比赛，他们一场都不会错过。”
马威是原中国女子曲棍球队员。2016年退役后，她选择回到家乡，和4名退役的女足姑娘一起成立劲拓体育足球俱乐部，她们凭借坚定的信念、专业的技能，毅然投身青少年体育事业。“当时就想着从足球入手，从中小学校园足球普及做起，让体育回归教育，让运动陪伴每一个家庭。”如今，经过近10年的发展，他们的教练团队从5人发展到了36人，体教融合的脚步走进了连云港市实验学校、解放路小学、浦南小学等十几所学校，带领了近万名小朋友接触足球、热爱足球。
“还记得连云港主场对阵淮安那一场，我还在同科校区做教案，周围有大屏直播，我只听到周围沸腾的声浪把我包围了，打开手机一看，连云港队2∶0战胜淮安。”马威告诉记者。作为负责人，她并不直接负责招生工作，就在当日晚上，她手机就接到了6个电话咨询，想让孩子学习踢足球。今年俱乐部暑期招生，比往年提升30%。
据了解，除了劲拓足球俱乐部，连云港市灌南县泰威足球培训有限公司、赣榆区小海星体育培训有限公司、开发区丰羽青训等多家体育类校外培训机构的暑期青少年足球培训报名人数均有所增加。
踢出热爱，业余球场的沸腾时光
与往年相比，今年寻求专业足球俱乐部指导的企业队伍明显增多。上周末，刚踢完2025年“中国体育彩票杯”徐圩新区足球赛第一轮的方洋集团足球队，就来到市体育休闲广场的足球场继续训练，队员们身着整齐的队服，在教练的指挥下，有条不紊地进行着传球、接球、战术配合等训练。
“受‘苏超’的影响，徐圩搞了自己的圩超，我们方洋的队伍全部来自我们的职工，以一线工人为主，有水厂、污水厂的工人，大陆桥酒店的后勤人员、工程管理人员等等。”方洋集团工会副主席曹熙明告诉记者，“‘苏超’的举办让大家看到了足球的魅力和影响力。我们集团一直注重员工的身心健康和团队凝聚力，组建足球队就是一个很好的方式。而且现在有专业的足球俱乐部指导，我们的训练更加科学和系统，水平也有了很大的提高。”
尽管第一轮比赛，有个角球站位失误，球弹门将身上进了球网，方洋集团队0∶1惜败新圩港队，但这支近乎“零基础”的队伍毫不气馁，纷纷约定提高训练频次，在以后的赛程中争取更好的成绩。
除了企业内部组建的足球队，业余足球队伍的覆盖面也在不断扩大。在各个社区、公园的足球场上，经常能看到业余足球爱好者们自发组织的比赛。这些比赛虽然没有专业的裁判和场地，但参赛者的热情却丝毫不减。
在昊海大厦边楼的室内足球场里，一场激烈的业余足球友谊比赛正在进行。双方队员你争我夺，互不相让。场边的队友时不时加油助威。“好球！”“传给他！”欢呼声和呐喊声此起彼伏。比赛结束后，双方队员互相握手致意，脸上洋溢着友谊和快乐的笑容。
“平时工作比较忙，但只要有训练、有球赛，大家都会挤出时间来踢一场。踢球不仅可以锻炼身体，还能结交很多志同道合的朋友，感觉生活变得更加充实了。”参赛选手张鹏飞说。
一城激情，联赛点燃港城盛夏
随着“苏超”的带动，县（市、区）各级足球赛事开展得如火如荼。上周末，连云港城市足球联赛战至第四轮，江苏银行队3∶2险胜星光湖队，中老年队0∶1惜败东城海鹰队；航运物流杯足球联赛热战正酣；灌南汤沟国藏杯夏季足球联赛、“中国体育彩票杯”徐圩新区足球赛等一系列赛事相继拉开帷幕，为港城的足球爱好者们搭建了一个展示自我的舞台。
在连云港融盛双语学校连云港城市足球联赛的赛场上，各支参赛队伍都派出了最强阵容。球员们在场上奔跑如飞，传球、射门、防守，每一个动作都充满了力量和激情。场边的观众也被比赛的氛围所感染，纷纷为自己支持的队伍呐喊助威。
“这届联赛的水平比往年高多了，很多队伍都引进了外援，比赛更加精彩了。”一位资深球迷说。的确，随着“苏超”的影响力不断扩大，越来越多的高水平球员和教练来到了连云港，为连云港市的足球赛事注入了新的活力。
航运物流杯足球联赛则吸引了海事、海关、海发、众诚等众多航运物流相关企事业单位的参与。这些企业在赛场上不仅展现了顽强的拼搏精神，还通过足球比赛加强了企业之间的交流与合作。主办方宁远物流朱文群董事长表示，“足球是一种很好的沟通方式，通过比赛，我们和其他企业建立了更加紧密的联系，为今后的业务合作打下了良好的基础。”
灌南汤沟国藏杯夏季足球联赛在灌南县掀起了一股足球热潮。当地的足球爱好者们积极参与，比赛现场气氛热烈。许多家长还带着孩子来观看比赛，让孩子感受足球的魅力。“带孩子来看比赛，就是想让他从小接触足球，培养他对体育的兴趣。”一位家长说。
来源：连云港发布
(责编：耿志超、吴纪攀) 分享让更多人看到
